results.title: Children are people (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dan Douglas, Stockwell College of Education and Lorna Ridgeway
results.brief_description: Shows a successful teaching experiment in primary schools in which classes are grouped vertically to include mixed ages, brothers and sisters. Explains how best children can be grouped and taught together so that they all enjoy school, learn effectively and develop their potential ability. Furthermore, it is claimed in the film that a more satisfactory social situation is created where social development is fostered to a greater degree than in single-age groups.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dan Douglas, Stockwell College of Education and Lorna Ridgeway

results.title: Children (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part two of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. This programme shows the relationship between mothers and children, paternal influence and the use of mother substitutes, education and the preparation of children for adult life in traditional and modern settings in 1970.

results.title: Children's world of travel
results.creator_credit: Shin Riken Motion Pictures and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Children have many dreams and there is a common dream the whole world over - travel. In this film, the dreams of Japanese children come true - in the realm of modern Japanese transport, with examples of the fast gleaming monorail, cable cars and other unusual systems in use in Japan today.

results.title: Children's value judgements (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Seligman, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Explains the four basic categories (intuitive, heteronomous, expedient, and altruistic) into which the cognitive styles used in making moral judgements are divided. Children are interviewed and their responses are labelled with one of these categories. Includes discussion of the implications of the postulated categories. A second level course in Educational Studies introduced by Norman Williams.

results.title: Children's thought and language
results.creator_credit: Michael Forlong Productions and Stefan Sargent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Looking at Research”.
The film outlines a project sponsored by the Social Science Research Council to study childhood development of intelligence and to discover how much children understand.

results.title: Children's Story Telling Caravan Bus
results.creator_credit: Hakuho Foundation for the Advancement of Children's Education
results.brief_description: One of the major activities of the Hakuho Foundation is the Children’s Storytelling Caravan Bus. The Caravan Bus travels to places where children gather, to provide a collection of books to children who are beginning to read. Co-operation exists among the caravan bus staff, made up of the storytellers, the rhythm game leaders, the artists who create the pictures and music and writers who provide the stories and rading matter. Special emphasis is also placed on travelling to those areas where the mothers do not recognise the importance of reading to children and thus not only providing enjoyment to the children but also influencing the mothers through these children. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Children's songs of Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Sotoji Kimura
results.brief_description: Children are much the same the whole world over - but the songs sung by the children of Japan are traditional and distinctive. Many are associated with the seasons and historical events while others are the simple type of songs associated with childhood adventures and fairy tale characters, but all have a truly Japanese character.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Sotoji Kimura

results.title: Children's song games = Comptines
results.brief_description: Springtime means being outside. It means being able to play hopscotch, and sing songs, and play with bolo-bats. This film is about little girls celebrating spring in Montreal. They play in alley-ways, in doorways, in parks, and on the street. They sing songs that were sung by their parents and maybe their grandparents. Gibberish rhymes, counting songs, and old folk songs ring out in children’s voices. Without commentary, this short sketch travels the by-ways of Montreal where little girls play. Comptines is a French word for children’s song games.

results.title: Children's play centres
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and National Fitness Council of Victoria
results.brief_description: During the Christmas holidays many Melbourne children are entertained and cared for at play centres, established by local authorities in association with the National Fitness Council. Short sequences show the youngsters taking part in various games under the guidance of trained leaders.
